definition: nothing left (money, food etc)/all finished/bright and shiny/radiant/glorious
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)

sentences.english: Is cold sky of light prologues, that mild eye Jing but all over undressed.
sentences.chinese: 冷天淡淡开口，那双平淡的眼精时而冒出精光。

sentences.english: A genuine effort, the little boy put a bowl of food stripped bare.
sentences.chinese: 一晃眼功夫，小男孩就把一碗饭吃个精光。

sentences.english: Okay, I spent all my money but the family had a wonderful time!
sentences.chinese: 我的确把钱都花了个精光，但是全家玩儿得可真痛快。

sentences.english: He won 500 and then blued the lot in three days.
sentences.chinese: 他赢了500英镑，可是才三天就花得精光。

sentences.english: She was so hungry, she cleaned her plate.
sentences.chinese: 她饿极了，把饭菜吃了个精光。

sentences.english: In a short while, the cat ate up the fish.
sentences.chinese: 不久，那只猫便将鱼吃个精光。

sentences.english: They also lost their shirts, and a lot of them have stopped coming.
sentences.chinese: 他们也输得个精光，很多人再也不来了。

sentences.english: He consented, and I immediately stripped myself stark naked, and went down softly into the stream.
sentences.chinese: 它同意后，我立刻脱得精光，然后慢慢地走进了河里。

sentences.english: He has been really taken to the cleaners and now he can hardly afford to keep his family.
sentences.chinese: 他的钱财简直被骗得精光，现在连家都养不起了。

sentences.english: She makes a salad and eats it up quickly.
sentences.chinese: 便做了一道沙拉，三两下就把它吃个精光。

sentences.english: He won 500 and then blued lot in three days.
sentences.chinese: 他赢了500英镑，郎是撑三添就哗得精光。

sentences.english: The guys ganged up on him and they took him to the cleaners .
sentences.chinese: 那帮家伙合伙欺负他，结果让他输的精光。

sentences.english: The bandits stripped the man to the skin.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪们把那人的衣服剥得精光。

definition: eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
to flash through (one's mind)/to dodge (away from pursuers)
to narrow one's eyes/to squint/(dialect) to take a nap
